node.statement: Commutation Identity: For g in GL_n(F), W(diag(g,1) u_Q) = psi^{-1}(Q g_{nn}) W(diag(g,1)), where g_{nn} is the (n,n)-entry of g. This follows from conjugating u_Q = I_{n+1} + Q E_{n,n+1} past diag(g,1): the element n'(g,Q) = I_{n+1} + Q sum_i g_{in} E_{i,n+1} lies in N_{n+1}, and the generic character psi^{-1} evaluates on n'(g,Q) to psi^{-1}(Q g_{nn}) since only the (n,n+1) superdiagonal entry contributes. The factor psi^{-1}(Q g_{nn}) is left-N_n-invariant, so the integrand remains well-defined on N_n \ GL_n(F).
